Name: Rabbit
WhereToFind: In most grassy areas of Medivia.
Strategy: They are very easy to kill, even for the most inexperienced player. It may help to use the chase opponent button as they will always try to run away from you.

Name: Dog
Strategy: Just attack them

Name: Sheep
WhereToFind: On Farms like the one around Thais
Femor Hills and grassy areas around Medivia.
Strategy: Sheep always run from attackers. Chase them and kill them with any weapon.

Name: Black Sheep
Strategy: Sheep always run from attackers. Chase them and kill them with any weapon.

Name: Deer
Strategy: Chase and attack them with any weapon. Players on Rookgard might have a difficult time catching them because they are quite fast.

Name: Pig
WhereToFind: some farms like The McRonald's Farm.
Strategy: Chase and attack them with any weapon.

Name: Rat
Strategy: Just attack them since they are very week. The most inexperienced players on Rookgard should watch out not to get surrounded by 2 or more Rats because you can die very easily in the beginning.

Name: Snake

Abilities.Name: Poison with 1 hp/turn and doing about 15 damage total

WhereToFind: Mostly in swampy areas around Medivia.
Strategy: Just attack them. Snakes are very weak monsters; they have the weakest defense. Even with fist fighting skill 10, you can kill a snake rather easily.

Name: Cave Rat
WhereToFind: In underground areas around Medivia. For example City sewers.
Strategy: Just attack them. At low levels, take care not to get attacked by 2 or more of them and don't get surrounded.

Name: Spider
WhereToFind: caves like as Ancient Temple and Rookgaard.
Strategy: Just attack them.

Name: Wolf
Strategy: Just attack them. Players on Rookgaard should be careful not to get surrounded.

Name: Bug
WhereToFind: In many parts of Medivia and Rookgard.
Strategy: They are very weak and slow, just attack them.

Name: Winter Wolf
Strategy: Treat them like Wolves.

Name: Troll
WhereToFind: In many dungeons around Tibianic like caves in Thais
south of Carlin (out the east exit and down the hole)
Edron Troll Cave and in Ab'Dendriel. Also found in Rookgaard.
Strategy: They are fairly weak; just attack them.

Name: Hyaena
WhereToFind: Desert areas like those around Ankrahmun and Darashia.
Strategy: Just attack them, and don't die.

Name: Poison Spider
WhereToFind: Found in various caves and plains around Tibia (including Rookgaard).
Strategy: Just attack them. The Poison is not worth curing with spells or runes. Just eat Food.

Name: Frost Troll
WhereToFind: Witch house to the west of Kazordon
Strategy: Treat them like normal Trolls.

Name: Bear
WhereToFind: north and a cave south (near the White Flower Temple) of Thais
south of Venore and many more places around Medivia.
Strategy: If you are in Rookgaard, be careful because they are strong creatures.

Name: Nether Spiderling

Abilities.Name: Poisons you (Starting at 2 health per turn)

Strategy: Kill them head on, but be weary if you are an inexperienced player as they may bring you into additional monsters.

Name: Wasp

Abilities.Name: If it Poisons, you will lose up to 2 hp per turn for 10 turns, totaling 20 damage

WhereToFind: Green Claw Swamp between Kazordoon and Venore
Strategy: Any Vocation Just attack them, they are weak for Level 8+

Name: Goblin
Strategy: Be careful in Rookgaard, because they can hit hard! You can hunt them profitable from Level 6 with decent equipment.

Name: Swamp Troll
Strategy: Just attack them, there's no big difference between them and Trolls. Always carry food, because the poison can be annoying for low levels and you need your hp regeneration. If you plan on hunting them while making runes make sure you have a decent gear, as the poison damages you quite abit you will have to use mana on healing instead of runes.

Name: Orc
Strategy: You should be at least Level 4 to fight them. Be careful when hunting them at low levels, as they might be with Orc Spearman too.

Name: Polar Bear
Strategy: Just attack them

Name: Cobra

Abilities.Name: Poison Spit (Poisons you up to 2 hp/turn)

Strategy: None

Name: Lion
Strategy: Not a very challenging creature but they attack in groups so be careful.

Name: Skeleton
WhereToFind: like the Ancient Temple and Ghostlands. Also found in Rookgaard tombs.
Strategy: Every item they drop besides torches and bones can be sold to NPCs for a good amount. Be sure to add them to your lootbag, especially the helmets. In Rookgaard, they are the best possible creatures to hunt (for both money and experience) at level 6 and above.

Name: Sand Troll
Strategy: They are fairly weak; just attack them.

Name: Orc Spearman
WhereToFind: North of Thais in the Orc Peninsula
Elvenbane and Orc. Also found in Rookgaard West plains.
Strategy: If you are in Rookgaard don't fight them unless you are level 7+ or you have good equipment and life fluids, they appear in groups and with Orcs. On the premium side; there are two single spawns of these creatures, if you trap them in a corner they aren't so hard and will start use their weaker melee attack.

Name: Rotworm
WhereToFind: Vilias Dungeon (upper) and Darashia caves and Edron. Also found in Rookgaard tombs
Strategy: If you cannot kill them fast or withstand attacks from several rotworms at once, never let yourself get trapped in a corner, as you cannot push rotworms. If you are in Rook, don't hunt them alone and get good equipment like Chain Armor, Legion Helmet and a Brass Shield. It also helps to carry around parcels (or boxes, while in Rookgaard) with you, since then you only have to take 1 or 2 at a time.

Name: Elf
Sounds: Flee as long as you can.
Strategy: Just attack them. Their melee is very easy to block, the only danger is the arrows, which are rarely used. They have low defense but be careful, they may be accompanied by Elf Scouts and Elf Arcanists, which are more dangerous. For Rookstayers, you can kill them easily at low level using melee or distance weapons.

Name: Larva
Strategy: They are easy to kill.

Name: Scorpion

Abilities.Name: can Poison for up to 17 hp/turn

Strategy: If you are hunting Scorpions, use distance fighting or runes.

Name: Dwarf
Strategy: Just attack them but be careful because they are usually found in groups and can be accompanied with Dwarf Soldiers and Dwarf Guards.

Name: Sand Spider
Strategy: Kill it as fast as possible. It's pretty squishy.

Name: Minotaur
WhereToFind: (Rookgaard) and also 2x on the premium side
Deeper Vilias Dungeon (level 50+ to open the door)
Strategy: If you are in Rookgaard, avoid attacking them alone, especially if there are more monsters around, it is easier to just run or trap them with boxes. In the mainland, they should not pose a major threat to a prepared adventurer.

Name: Orc Warrior
Strategy: Dangerous for bad equipped or lower levels. They have a decent armor so make sure you have enough skills and a good weapon when fighting as a Knight. Their exp / hp ratio is horrible but it is worth killing them when hunting stronger Orcs as they drop Chain Armors which are a good lootbag item.

Name: War Wolf
Strategy: When killing those just be careful that you do not run into to many other War Wolves or other Orcs as they usually come in groups. Not a monster which is hunted often as the exp / hp ratio is horrible, they do not drop anything useful except for the food and there are no spawns without any other stronger monsters.

Name: Wild Warrior
WhereToFind: huge spawn in the Vigilantes' Hideout
Strategy: None

Name: Amazon
Strategy: As a Knight just rush to them. Their defence is really low so you should deal good damage. Watch out that you do not lure too many if your EQ is not that great. Keep in mind that your shielding does not effect the damage their knifes do.

Name: Minotaur Archer
WhereToFind: Deeper Vilias Dungeon (level 50+ to open the door)
Strategy: Run towards them and don't let him attack from a distance. Usually in company of Minotaur Guards and Minotaur Mages. Be careful, as this creature is strong and can kill an inexperienced player pretty quickly. Stealth Rings can be a big help when facing many of these.

Name: Bandit
WhereToFind: North-West of Orc Fort <!-- ws:start:WikiTextMediaRule:0:<img src="http://www.wikispaces.com/site/embedthumbnail/custom/26854152?h=0&w=0" class="WikiMedia WikiMediaCustom" id="wikitext@@media@@type=&quot;custom&quot; key=&quot;26854152&quot;" title="Custom Media"/> -->here<!-- ws:end:WikiTextMediaRule:0 --> . (It's been reported that the spawn is missing. Apparently it's due to the new houses added to the area.)
Strategy: Similar to a Wild Warrior, except with more health. Most players shouldn't have a problem with them.

Name: Dwarf Soldier
WhereToFind: Dwarf Mines west of Femor Hills
Strategy: Don't attack them in low levels.

Name: Elf Scout
Sounds: Feel the sting of my arrows!
Thy blood will quench the soil's thirst!.
Strategy: None

Name: Mutated Rat
Strategy: It is a very weak monster. It should not give you any trouble, except on Rookgaard, where you should stay clear of these as they are stronger than Minotaurs.

Name: Ghoul
WhereToFind: Ancient Temple in the Skeleton area
below Point of No Return in Outlaw Camp
Also found behind a wall in both Rookgaard and Paradox Tower
Strategy: None

Name: Valkyrie
WhereToFind: single respawn to the north west of Thais
Strategy: It is better to attack them from a distance because their Spears are weaker than their Melee fighting. Usually found around with Amazons and/or Witches.

Name: Stalker
WhereToFind: Edron Hero Cave in the Warlock room
Strategy: None

Name: Gazer
Strategy: If there are more than one Summoned Gazers, it is useful to use Great Fireball to kill them quickly.

Name: Valkyrie Cavalry
Sounds: All males will be our slaves
Strategy: It is better to attack them from distance because their Spears are weaker than their Melee fighting. Usually found around with Amazons and/or Witches.

Name: Orc Shaman
WhereToFind: Hero caves and in Warlock room (in Hero Cave)
Below Point of No Return in Outlaw Camp
north west of Thais in the tower with War Wolf
Strategy: Unless you're surrounded by four or more of these orcs (in which case you just GFB), don't bother killing the snakes to avoid breaking your shielding, because an Orc Shaman attacks with Magical Damage so it will pierce your armor. Kill the Orc Shaman and the snakes will die instantly, then use Antidote or an Antidote Rune if needed.

Name: Orc Rider
WhereToFind: Orc Fort and north of Thais in the "Orc Peninsula". South-west of PoH.
Strategy: If you are a mage, Use Invisible and use Runes, GFB are useful because Orc Riders are usually found in groups.

Name: Fire Devil
WhereToFind: Plains of Havoc at Ornamented Shield Quest
Strategy: They wont come to you, you will have to go to them.

Name: Ghost
Strategy: Use Full Defense mode and shoot runes. They move slowly, so running from them is not difficult.

Name: Witch
WhereToFind: West of the Dwarf Mines in a small house
Edron Hero Cave in the Warlock room
Green Claw Swamp and Amazon Camp (Venore)
Strategy: Be careful because they can attack you even before you see them. If you are alone, do not attack more than one witch, since they can damage you fairly fast.

Name: Scarab
WhereToFind: the sand around Ankrahmun (use a shovel)
Strategy: None

Name: Mummy
Strategy: When hunting Mummies, try to have a large amount of mana ready in order to use exura, which will cure paralysis. A good strategy for distance fighters hunting this monster (druids, sorcerers, or paladins) is this; If you are paralyzed, and can still move about as fast as the Mummy, continue running it until either the paralyze wears off or it paralyzes you again. One exura will cancel out all paralysis, not just the last one casted against you. However, obstructions or lag can result in the Mummy catching up and attacking the player. Any attack suffered by a Mummy will cause a poison starting at the 1-3 hp level. GFBs and explosions are useful in case of a tight situation.

Name: Minotaur Mage
Strategy: Minotaur Mages deal a lot of damage. Do not hunt them for their loot. Mages tend to kill them in the Dark Pyramid as they yield great exp for their hp. You cannot profit on them.

Name: Hunter
WhereToFind: at the entrance and in the Hero Cave
Strategy: None

Name: Gargoyle
Sounds: There is a stone in your shoe!
Strategy: They are easier than a Cyclops, but rarely come without other creatures. They heal more when they are running, meaning they'll return for the fatal blow.

Name: Cyclops
Strategy: None

Name: Slime
WhereToFind: Thais Ancient Temple under the Rotworm area
in Folda on the floor above the Water Elemental
Troll cave east of dwarf bridge
on a cave northeast of Ab'Dendriel
east of plains of havoc cyclops spawn in a cave.
Strategy: A good tactic is to mark the slime that summons the others as only the original will do this. When a slime summons, you will see the blue shimmer of a spell being cast. If you can't pick out the original while you're attacking, don't hesitate to start attacking the next slime. Though at times you will find that your second target is only a copy and it will disappear if the slime you killed before it was the original, it is better to be safe in case the first slime is not the original slime.

Name: Minotaur Guard
WhereToFind: Deeper Vilias Dungeon (level 50+ to open the door)
Strategy: None

Name: Stone Golem
WhereToFind: in and around Blue Djinn Tower
Strategy: They don't take off high damage, a medium leveled knight should be able to block them easily. Paladins should run and shoot. Treat it like a strong cyclops.

Name: Dwarf Slayer
WhereToFind: Molten Rock Clan Cave (near Kazordoon game rooms)

Name: Dwarf Guard
Strategy: None

Name: Beholder
Sounds: Let me take a look at you.
WhereToFind: shortcut back from Mintwallin and in the Venore Swamps
Strategy: None

Name: Elf Arcanist
Sounds: For the Daughter of the Stars!
Strategy: None

Name: Orc Bowman
WhereToFind: Many of them are on the Ice Island Coldrige. During Orc raid on Thais Lighthouse and Castle. Two of them spawn at 4th floor of Lighthouse. Orc Fortress <!-- ws:start:WikiTextMediaRule:0:<img src="http://www.wikispaces.com/site/embedthumbnail/custom/28188625?h=0&w=0" class="WikiMedia WikiMediaCustom" id="wikitext@@media@@type=&quot;custom&quot; key=&quot;28188625&quot;" title="Custom Media"/> --><!-- ws:end:WikiTextMediaRule:0 -->
Strategy: None

Name: Elf Guardian
Strategy: Avoid getting in melee range if you are not a knight.

Name: Orc Berserker
WhereToFind: below Point of No Return in Outlaw Camp
Strategy: Stealth Ring can be a life saver when coming across these creatures at low levels. With all vocations these can be handled easily with care. The Halberds dropped by Berserkers allow for good profit for all vocations.

Name: Crypt Shambler
Strategy: Strategy

Name: Slave Hunter

Abilities.Name: Causes energized status which starts at 25 damage and ends at 1 damage dealing 325 total damage over 40 seconds

Strategy: Kill them fast. Use Strange Talisman to reduce the damage taken from their energized attack.

Name: Green Djinn

Abilities.Name: Cancel Invisibility, turns you into a Rat

Sounds: I wish you a merry trip to hell!
WhereToFind: Serpentine Tower last floor behind the Magic Walls
Strategy: It is highly recommended to wear a Dwarven Ring as it can save you a trip back to the Temple! When Djinns make you drunk, it is very hard to control your movements. They can make you very drunk.

Name: Blue Djinn

Abilities.Name: Cancel Invisibility, turns you into a rabbit

Sounds: Feel the power of my magic, tiny mortal!
Be careful what you wish for..
Strategy: If you can find a Dwarven Ring, wear it. When the Djinn makes you drunk, you sometimes don't have total control of your movements. It is very wise to wear this, as it can lower the chance of a trip back to the Temple. It is also good that you wear a Dragon Necklace to lower the damage inflicted by their fire attacks - In melee they use Fire Attack less frequently so try to close them fast.

Name: Monk
Sounds: A prayer to the almighty one!
Strategy: Something important while killing Monks is the time. You have to attack as fast as possible or they will heal themselves and you will need to use more Arrows/Runes, or, in the case of Knights, you will receive more damage and maybe use more healing runes or spells. Quite high defense, so low skilled knights with one-handed weapons should stay away from these, as they will heal faster than you will damage them. If necessary to kill, consider using runes.

Name: Fire Elemental
Strategy: Kill them quickly before they can deliver too much damage. It is recommended to run towards them, since they do their distance attacks less often then.

Loot.Name: they leave a fire field behind after they have died

Name: Demon Skeleton
Strategy: None

Name: Dwarf Geomancer
WhereToFind: Triangle Tower and below mount sternum
Strategy: It is recommended to kill these creatures in groups, due to the fact that they heal fast. Try to use all of your mana before facing them, as they will quickly drain it away from you.

Name: Harpy
WhereToFind: in the mountains south-west from the city.
Strategy: None

Name: Ember Beetle
Strategy: Simple monster, relatively easy to kill at level 35+, lower level mages should watch out for large groups and try not to get surrounded.

Name: Orc Leader
WhereToFind: South of the temple in PoH
Strategy: None

Name: Elder Beholder

Abilities.Name: Energy missile, and Physical distance attacks

Sounds: Inferior creatures, bow before my power!
Let me take a look at you!
WhereToFind: near the Hellgate Library (with The Evil Eye spawn)
Strategy: The best way to kill them is for mages to use runes, and paladins to use bolts or arrows since they try to keep their distance from you, and may pull you into more Beholders and other creatures.

Name: Vampire
Sounds: I call you, my bats! Come!.
Strategy: A team for a vampire hunt can consist of one knight of about level 30, plus a couple of shooters. More shooters and better skills will make vampires less expensive to hunt, but you probably will not break even until it drops Vampire Shield. The vampire shield is a great loot item for a relatively easy creature, but you may find yourself trying for weeks to loot one.

Name: Cyclops Warrior
WhereToFind: Forgula (up a mountain/underground west before the wall)
Strategy: None

Name: Efreet

Abilities.Name: Summons 0-2 Green Djinns, turns you into a Rat

Strategy: Do not approach Efreets at a low level. They are extremely dangerous and only susceptible to Physical Damage. Always wear a Dwarven Ring when you have to face them.

Name: Marid
Sounds: Feel the power of my magic, tiny mortal!
Strategy: Wear a Dwarven Ring at all times when facing these. If hunting in the Ashta'daramai, bring a good blocker and a sorcerer that can use Ultimate Explosion. Because of the large number of creatures in the small rooms of the Blue Djinn Fortress (and that they all have strong distance attacks), you can lose up to 800 or more hitpoints just from "peeking" up the steps. Even though this creature only yields 410 experience points, they can be as deadly as a Dragon Lord.

Name: Harpy Spellweaver
Strategy: None

Name: Elf Sharpshooter
Sounds: Feel the sting of my arrows!
Thy blood will quench the soil's thirst!
Thy armor will crush by my arrows!
You are no longer unsighted, human!
Strategy: They run extremely fast, so it is important to have some runes to kill them with more ease.

Name: Priestess
Sounds: Now your life is come to the end, hahahaha!.
Strategy: Priestess are not meant to be hunted. You don't want to face them. If you have to meet them you should try to kill them as fast as possible. As a solo mage the best solution is to just SD them. you will most likely one-shoot them. The reason for wasting SDs on this creature is that the mana drain will hurt you really bad. They can easily drain up to 300 mana in no time. Knights should spend all their mana before facing them. Once you mana is gone, they are really weak. That's why you should always let the knights kill them. Paladins should probably also SD them, depending on your current mana.

Name: Dwarf Dragoneater
Sounds: You cannot lift that barrel, eh?, Where is the beer?, The dragon ham gives us power!, To the arms, enemies sighted!
WhereToFind: Molten Rock Clan Cave (near Kazordoon game rooms) and Dragoneater Fellowship

Name: Giant Jellyfish
WhereToFind: Dwarven Mine (below slime cave)<!-- ws:start:WikiTextMediaRule:0:<img src="http://www.wikispaces.com/site/embedthumbnail/custom/27917709?h=0&w=0" class="WikiMedia WikiMediaCustom" id="wikitext@@media@@type=&quot;custom&quot; key=&quot;27917709&quot;" title="Custom Media"/> --><!-- ws:end:WikiTextMediaRule:0 -->
Strategy: Kill them fast before they summon too many clones.

Name: Bonebeast
Strategy: Use blockers to lure it, but avoid contact, while distance fighters shoot at it. A level 40 mage can survive healing with Intense Healing spell when soloing it. It's not recommended for knights to attempt soloing a bonebeast until level 50+. They yield good experience, especially for paladins considering it's not hard to kill them at a distance. Mages should run and use Hmms or Gfbs.

Name: Sandbeast
WhereToFind: In the mountains south of Abukir desert.
Strategy: Either run them and keep away from their double melee as a mage/paladin or as a knight try to face just one at a time.

Name: Necromancer
Sounds: Taste the sweetness of death!, Your corpse will be mine.
Strategy: Mid-level Mages can summon 2 Demon Skeletons to kill Necromancers in Drefia, the most common place to hunt them. Paladins should use Bolt+Heavy Magic Missile. Knights can solo these but it is not recommended as their damage is a lot higher in melee range.

Name: Elf Swordmaster
Sounds: Thy blood will quench the soil's thirst!
Strategy: One way of avoiding this monster is to just leave it at low hp so it runs away, it won't attack or heal. It is worth stair hopping against them, even for knights, since they attack 2 times per turn and the techinique will cause you to avoid one of the attacks.

Name: Harpy Queen
Sounds: You shall not disturb my tribe!
Bow before a queen, filthy human!.
Strategy: None

Name: Thaian Soldier
Sounds: We will clean the streets of Thais!
Strategy: Either try to keep your distance or trap yourself where as few as possible can hit you at once. They are weak on their own but as they often come in groups of 3 or more they can quickly deal a large amount of damage.

Name: Orc Warlord
Strategy: To beat these powerful creatures you will need to get a good team with high-skilled Knights, Paladins and Mages with a high Magic Level. The best way to kill them is from a distance because their Throwing Stars are weaker than their close combat. Knights with skills 90/90 and a Decent weapon can kill them fairly easy. As with all creatures that use invisibility, stay alert with an exori to turn them visible again. Its attacks can be compared to a Giant Spider.

Name: Dragon
WhereToFind: southern cave and dragon tower in Shadowthorn
Strategy: All players should stand diagonal from the dragon, whenever possible, to avoid the Fire Wave.

Name: Ancient Scarab
Strategy: Do not try to hunt Ancient Scarabs solo unless you are high level. The best team consist of a mage and a knight. The knight lures 2 AS and the mage kills them off as fast as possible. If you kill them 1 by 1 a Knight with a Paladin can also be a nice group.

Name: Sandskull Spider
Strategy: It is slow and has a weaker melee attack and lower defense then a Giant Spider but it frequently summons Sand Spiders that are extremely fast and will break your shielding. Try to kill it as quick as possible and do not waste time on killing summons because it will just spawn new ones almost instantly. The shield break from its summons make you take a lot of damage.

Name: Archer
Strategy: Stronger version of Hunter

Name: Lich
Sounds: You will endure agony beyond thy death!
Strategy: You should always try to stand diagonal from them, since their beam attack is very strong. Liches summon Bonebeasts very fast, so you should kill it as fast as you can. Although they only yield 1800 experience points, a Lich can be as deadly as a Dragon Lord. The fact that they are so strong and rarely hunted leads to very expensive Castle Shields, as they are only dropped by Liches.

Name: Banshee
Sounds: Dance for me your dance of death!
Feel my gentle kiss of death!
Strategy: Bring them down as quickly as you can (SD) before major damage is done. Don't let them run away with low health, they will return healed up.

Name: Giant Spider
Strategy: Mostly Paladins hunt Giant Spiders. They have a really strong melee attack which makes it impossible to hunt within melee range. Their Haste combined with the melee is the reason why this monster is feared by low levels. Usually, you meet GS in the PoH as it is a frequently hunted spawn. If low levels meet one it is already too late.

Name: Ogre Gruntz
Strategy: None

Name: Tar Monstrosity
Strategy: The largest damage by far comes from their life drain attacks so wearing a Garlic Necklace for the 20% protection makes a huge difference.

Name: Dwarf Renegade
Sounds: Where is my bloody axe?, Long live the Lightbringers!, Rage against them!, Death to Durin!
Strategy: The easiest way is to let Dwarf Soldiers surround you and kill the Renegade with HMMs: here

Name: Slave Guard
Strategy: None

Name: Vigilante
Sounds: It seems like we have unwanted guests
You should have left us alone.
Strategy: Easy to hunt as a paladin. Just keep your distance as the melee can hit hard but they don't do much damage from distance. There is plenty of open space to run around in the Hideout. Not worth hunting as a mage as they are immune to energy; you will have to use Explosions or Sudden Death Runes to take them down.

Name: Hero
Sounds: I will sing a tune at your grave.
Strategy: A team hunting these may consist of a Knight blocking and using Challenge regularly, these are easy to kill from a medium level of about 50, although it probably won't be profitable. Although if a mage/s summon Demon Skeletons while using the Light Heal Friend spell (if they are a Druid), waste can be kept to a minimum and you can possibly make a lot of profit.

Name: Black Knight
WhereToFind: Only in the Black Knight's Villa.
Strategy: As they only cause Physical Damage you need to have a blocker if you want to hunt them. A Knight around level 35 with decent skills and gear is able to block it. Kill it as fast as possible so the Knight does not need too much healing. The most efficient way is to stand south in the room next to the teleport with 2 demon skeletons summoned. The Black Knight will spawn north and come. The Knight tanks it and both the Knight and the Mage attack it in full def so the shield is broken and the DS can do more damage. As a mage you might want to be careful and use manashield as they can change targets and combo you easily. Keep in mind that the BK spawn is really slow (18 mins).

Name: Nether Spider

Abilities.Name: Distance Web Attack (Poisons you up to 16hp/turn

Strategy: 1 knight and 2 mages can summon 4 Demon Skeletons and stay at the entrance. The knight will lure the Nether Spiders one by one. The mages then use hmm runes, while their Demon Skeletons surround the spider. The immediate defense break will lead to a sufficient way of saving uhs as knight and will give the mages a fair amount of experience. Here an example picture: Click

Name: Ogre Smasher
Strategy: None

Name: Dragon Lord
Strategy: None

Name: Ogre Warrior
Strategy: None

Name: Daraman Prayer
Strategy: Trap it in a corner and use HMMs to speed up the killing.

Name: Traitor
Strategy: Hero on steroids. Kill them as fast as possible before they heal themselves and you will need to use more supplies.

Name: Corrupted Spider
Strategy: Does not have any distance attacks so run, just don't run into more. There is little point in any vocation but paladins hunting them due to their relatively poor loot, very high melee combat damage and immunity to energy.

Name: Ancient Golem
WhereToFind: Mountains south of Abukir. Seal of god Mons
Strategy: When blocking these its important to stand directly adjacent to them, as their poison strike hits diagonal squares. High level paladins can solo given enough space to run around.

Name: Behemoth
WhereToFind: deepest part of Tarpit Tomb after the flame and deeper Abukir quest area.
Strategy: Behemoth are one of the tankiest monsters in Medivia. They have bad exp/hp-ratio and give bad loot so they are rarely hunted.

Name: Manticore
Strategy: None

Name: Lightbringer Knight
Sounds: Fight with blood, fight with steel, die with honor, never yield!
We shall crush the Thaian Amy!

Name: Shattered Soul
Strategy: None

Name: Warlock
Sounds: Even a rat is a better mage than you!
Learn the secret of our magic! YOUR death!
Strategy: They are extremely dangerous. They use invisibility very frequently and keep their distance, so it's hard to tell where they are.

Name: Wight
Strategy: Click here to see a example on how to hunt them using summoned demon skeletons.

Name: Tar Priest
Sounds: I shall purge you in the name of Suffocent
Allow the corruption to flow through your body!.
WhereToFind: Found in the corruption as well as some areas underneath and within the Abukir mountain range.
Strategy: These creatures are fairly strong due to their summons so it's recommended to hunt in teams consisting of a blocker and shooters. In some situations the summons can be manipulated to prevent shield break on the blocker. If you can remove the summons by for example shutting them out the Tar Priest by itself presents a limited threat. Its own attacks are less threatening than a dragon so the biggest issue you'll have is your mana getting drained fast.

Name: Lernaean Hydra
WhereToFind: found on several jungle islands. Accessible through a mountain path.
Strategy: High level is recommended to fight hydras, a blocker is usually necessary as well as some shooters. Pay special care and attention to the shape of the wave and the direction the hydra faces.

Name: Albino Dragon
Sounds: YOU SHOULD NOT HAVE COME INTO MY LAIR!
YOUR KIND SHALL LEAVE ME IN PEACE!
Strategy: Treat it like you would treat Demodras.

Name: Royalist
Sounds: Death to all traitors!, I pledged myself to Tibianus' order,
Strategy: Bring as many shooters as possible to burst through their heavy healing as fast as possible and block it in small passages so you do not have to tank any or only few Thaian Soldiers since he summons them quickly. Even though you usually waste while hunting them they have one of the greatest HP/EXP ratios ingame and will give you pretty decent experience while doing the task.

Name: Frost Dragon
Strategy: Like with a Dragon or Dragon Lord, try standing diagonally to the Frost Dragon in order to dodge their Ice Wave.

Name: Undead Dragon
Strategy: It can be hunted by a team consisting of high levels; blocker, healer and a couple of shooters. Keep in mind that Undead Dragon can combo down a 200 EK.

Name: Demon
WhereToFind: One can also be seen in Ghostlands
however it can't be reached nor killed.
Strategy: One of the strongest monster spawns in the game. You cannot solo hunt these monsters until extremely high levels hoping for profit or good exp. The best way of killing them is with one good blocker and one or two good mages. Bring a lot of backpacks of SD's (it's not worth going for demons with only 10 backpack SD's) and many UH's. It's better to use Boots of Haste at lower levels instead of Steel Boots (arguably) because Demons are fast and staying diagonal can be hard.

Name: Abomination
Strategy: With stairhopping it is possible to solo an Abomination with a paladin (at least level 140) but a team consisting of one knight and a few shooters is preferable.

Name: Chimera
WhereToFind: East of Abukir near Wulkan has 1 Chimera spawn. North-east of the island of corruption has a big spawn. Foreign Lands has the biggest spawn.
Strategy: None

Name: Lightbringer Hero
Sounds: You know nothing about this world!
Stand still, so I can decollate you.

Name: Queen's Follower
Sounds: I chose to die than yield!
